org.ingatan.component.image
Class ImageAcquisitionDialog

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Dialog
                  javax.swing.JDialog
                      org.ingatan.component.image.ImageAcquisitionDialog
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class ImageAcquisitionDialog
extends javax.swing.JDialog
implements java.awt.event.WindowListener

Extension of the JFrame that ties together all image acquisition methods into a menu. The image acquisition options are:

  • Load from file
  • Import from library
  • Select from Ingatan's inbuilt resource library
  • Create a new image

Version:
1.0
Author:
Thomas Everingham
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constant Field Values

MAX_IMAGE_WIDTH

protected static final int MAX_IMAGE_WIDTH
Maximum width of images the can be imported. If too large, the user will be asked whether the image should be resized.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

MAX_IMAGE_HEIGHT

protected static final int MAX_IMAGE_HEIGHT
Maximum height of images that can be imported. If too large, the user will be asked whether the image should be resized.

protected ImageCollectionBrowser collectionBrowser
Component for browsing through collections of provided images. Essentially this is a clip art gallery.

protected ImageEditorPane editorPane
Component for editing images or creating a new image.

chemEditorPane

protected MainPanel chemEditorPane
SketchEl chemistry editor pane. For the drawing of nice vector chem sketches. (c) 2007-2009 Dr. Alex M. Clark, under the GNU License: www.gnu.org for details.

acquiredImage

protected java.awt.image.BufferedImage acquiredImage
The image that has been acquired in whatever way chosen. This will be generated when the user selects the 'use image' button.

acquiredImageSource

protected java.lang.String acquiredImageSource
Upon an image being chosen, this String holds the most sensible description of that image. For example, if the image was chosen from file, this string will be the filename of the image (without the path). This will hold the math text if the source was math text.

imageSource

protected int imageSource
The currently displayed acquisition source. Set to one of the 'FROM_' fields of this class.

reset

public void reset()
Reset the image acquisition dialog so that it no longer contains the previous selection data.

getAcquiredImage

public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getAcquiredImage()
Gets the image that has been acquired.

Returns:
the image that has been acquired.

getAcquiredImageData

public java.lang.String getAcquiredImageData()
Gets the logical name of the source image.

Returns:
the logical name of the source image. If taken from file, then this will be the file name, if created from new, it will be something like "new600x400".

setEditorDocumentImage

public void setEditorDocumentImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
Sets the image editor's document image.

Parameters:
image - the image to set to the canvas.

setEditorOnly

public void setEditorOnly(boolean editor)

getAcquisitionSource

public int getAcquisitionSource()
Gets the source of image acquisition. Check this with one of the fields of this class (ImageAcquisitionDialog). Possible values are FROM_NEW, FROM_FILE, FROM_LIBRARY... etc.

Returns:
the source of the image. Check this value up against one of the fields of the ImageAcquisitionDialog class.

setUpKeyBindingsForEditorPane

public void setUpKeyBindingsForEditorPane()
Sets up the key bindings for the image editor pane. The key bindings are set to the root pane of the ImageAcquisitionDialog, as WHEN_ANCESTOR_OF_FOCUSSED_COMPONENT. Keybindings include ctrl+z/y undo redo, ctrl+a select all, delete for clear, etc.
